info.description:
APIs to cater for Inventory functionality in OPERA Cloud. This includes sell limits for date ranges, viewing and updating the properties inventory, as well as item inventory (such as rollaways, microwaves etc.).

This document and all content within is available under the Universal Permissive License v 1.0 (http://oss.oracle.com/licenses/upl). Copyright c 2021 Oracle and/or its affiliates.
info.title: Early Release OPERA Cloud Inventory API

tags.name: Inventory
tags.description: The Inventory APIs provide the ability to fetch Hotel Room Type Inventory and manage overbooking/sell limits at different levels. It also contains operations to get item inventory for a property.

get.description:
You can use this API to retrieve the inventory for a specified hotel. Narrow down your results using the query parameters such as a date range, room type, room class, and/or tentative inventory included.

OperationId:getHotelInventory

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of the hotel where hotel inventory is searched.

parameters.name: roomCountRequested
parameters.description: Number of rooms requested.

parameters.name: includeTentativeInventory
parameters.description: If set to true, includes non-deduct/Tentative rooms for a date range.

parameters.name: dailyInventory
parameters.description: If false minimum inventory for the date range is requested, otherwise inventory is requested for every day.

parameters.name: houseLevel
parameters.description: Indicates that House level inventory is requested.

parameters.name: roomTypes
parameters.description: Room Type Code.

parameters.name: roomClasses
parameters.description: Room Class Code.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: Bearer token that needs to be passed which is generated post user authentication

parameters.name: x-app-key
parameters.description: Client or Partnerâ€™s Application Key

parameters.name: x-hotelid
parameters.description: Mandatory parameter to identify the hotel code where the endDate user is logged in

parameters.name: x-externalsystem
parameters.description: External system code.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Language code

200.description: A response for Hotel Inventories meeting the search criteria. Returns inventory classified on room type, class and house level for a given property.

get.description:
This will fetch a hotels inventory statistics for a specified date range that you can provided in the request.

OperationId:getInventoryStatistics

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Unique ID of the hotel where inventory statistics are searched.

parameters.name: dateRangeEnd
parameters.description: The ending value of the date range.

parameters.name: reportCode
parameters.description: Identifies the type of statistics collected. Each ReportCode corresponds to a set of category summaries based upon a predetermined agreement.

parameters.name: dateRangeStart
parameters.description: The starting value of the date range.

parameters.name: parameterName
parameters.description: Name of the parameter.

parameters.name: parameterValue
parameters.description: Value of the parameter.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: Bearer token that needs to be passed which is generated post user authentication

parameters.name: x-app-key
parameters.description: Client or Partnerâ€™s Application Key

parameters.name: x-hotelid
parameters.description: Mandatory parameter to identify the hotel code where the endDate user is logged in

parameters.name: x-externalsystem
parameters.description: External system code.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Language code

200.description: Object that holds the details of inventory Statistics.

hotelInventories.description: Refer to Inventory common types document.

hotelInventory.description: A response for Hotel Inventories meeting the search criteria. Returns inventory classified on room type, class and house level for a given property.

houseInventory.description: Collection of House level Inventory counts for the date ranges.

roomTypeInventories.description: Collection of Room type level Inventory counts for the date ranges.

roomClassInventories.description: Collection of Room Class level Inventory counts for the date ranges.

hotelInventoryType.description: A collection of Reservation objects and Unique IDs of Reservation.

inventoryCountsListType.description: Collection of Inventory counts for the date ranges.

available.description: Indicates whether enough inventory is available or not.

startDate.description: The starting value of the date range.

endDate.description: The ending value of the date range.

inventoryCountsType.description: Inventory counts for the given date range.

inventoryCounts.description: Collection of Inventory counts for the date ranges.

inventoryLevelCountsListType.description: Collection of Inventory counts for the date ranges.

href.description: URI [RFC3986] or URI Template [RFC6570]. If the value is set to URI Template, then the "templated" property must be set to true.

rel.description: Name of the link relation that, in addition to the type property, can be used to retrieve link details. For example, href or profile.

templated.description: Boolean flag that specifies that "href" property is a URI or URI Template. If the property is a URI template, set this value to true. By default, this value is false.

method.description: HTTP method for requesting the target of the link.

targetSchema.description: Link to the metadata of the resource, such as JSON-schema, that describes the resource expected when dereferencing the target resource..

operationId.description: The operationId of the path you can call to follow this link.  This allows you to look up not only the path and method, but the description of that path and any parameters you need to supply.

title.description: Exact copy of the "summary" field on the linked operation.

instanceLink.description: Metadata describing link description objects that MAY appear in the JSON instance representation.

warningsType.description: Used in conjunction with the Success element to define a business error.

shortText.description: An abbreviated version of the error in textual format.

code.description: If present, this refers to a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings.

docURL.description: If present, this URL refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

status.description: If present, recommended values are those enumerated in the ErrorRS, (NotProcessed Incomplete Complete Unknown) however, the data type is designated as string data, recognizing that trading partners may identify additional status conditions not included in the enumeration.

tag.description: If present, this attribute may identify an unknown or misspelled tag that caused an error in processing. It is recommended that the Tag attribute use XPath notation to identify the location of a tag in the event that more than one tag of the same name is present in the document. Alternatively, the tag name alone can be used to identify missing data [Type=ReqFieldMissing].

recordId.description: If present, this attribute allows for batch processing and the identification of the record that failed amongst a group of records. This value may contain a concatenation of a unique failed transaction ID with specific record(s) associated with that transaction.

type.description: The Warning element MUST contain the Type attribute that uses a recommended set of values to indicate the warning type. The validating XSD can expect to accept values that it has NOT been explicitly coded for and process them by using Type ="Unknown".

rph.description: Reference Place Holder used as an index for this warning.

warningType.description: Used when a message has been successfully processed to report any warnings or business errors that occurred.

type.description: Absolute URI [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.  When dereferenced, it SHOULD provide a human-readable summary of the problem (for example, using HTML).

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem.  The summary SHOULD NOT change for subsequent occurrences of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.description: HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem, set by the origin server.

detail.description: Human-readable description specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: Absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.  It may or may not provide additional information if dereferenced.

o:errorCode.description: Application error code, which is different from HTTP error code.

o:errorPath.description: Path to the problem at the resource or property level.

o:errorDetails.description: Details of the error message, consisting of a hierarchical tree structure.

exceptionDetailType.title: Error Detail
exceptionDetailType.description: Complex type that contains error details for a REST call.

type.description: Absolute URI [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.  When dereferenced, it SHOULD provide a human-readable summary of the problem (for example, using HTML).

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem.  The summary SHOULD NOT change for subsequent occurrences of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.description: HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem, set by the origin server.

detail.description: Human-readable description specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: Absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.  It may or may not provide additional information if dereferenced.

o:errorCode.description: Application error code, which is different from HTTP error code.

o:errorPath.description: Path to the problem at the resource or property level.

errorInstance.title: Error Instance Details
errorInstance.description: Complex type that contains error instance details for a REST call.

inventoryStatistics.description: List of inventory statistics that is grouped by statistic date.

hotelName.description: A text field used to communicate the proper name of the hotel.

reportCode.description: Identifies the type of statistics collected. Each ReportCode corresponds to a set of category summaries based upon a predetermined agreement.

description.description: This element has revenue amount data for its revenue category such as Room Revenue, Food and Beverage Revenue.

statisticType.description: Defines all details needed to create a statistical report.

statCode.description: Actual code used by the system to collect the statistics (e.g. CORP, RACK if category is Market Segment).

statCategoryCode.description: Category Code category of StatCode attribute (e.g. Market Segment).

statisticCodeType.description: Defines the codes and corresponding categories for which the data in the other elements has been gathered.

revenue.description: Collection of RevenueCategorySummary elements. Used if revenue values reported.

inventory.description: Collection of CountCategorySummary elements. Used if count values reported.

weekendDate.description: Determines whether statistic date is a weekend date.

statisticSetType.description: An instance of a statistic, which is a set containing revenue category and number category summaries.

code.description: The representation of a revenue category.

currencyCode.description: Provides a currency code to reflect the currency in which an amount may be expressed.

revenueCategorySummaryType.description: This element has revenue amount data for its revenue category such as Room Revenue, Food and Beverage Revenue.

value.description: The total count for the category in NumericCategoryCode.

code.description: The representation of a numeric category such as Guests : Number of guests, RoomsOcc : Rooms occupied.

numericCategorySummaryType.description: This element has count data for each count category such as number of guests, rooms occupied, etc.

authKey.name: authorization
authKey.description: Bearer token that needs to be passed which is generated post user authentication

x-hotelid.name: x-hotelid
x-hotelid.description: Mandatory parameter to identify the hotel code where the endDate user is logged in
